item.title: Jen add a quote by Jonathan Hull
item.description: "I've known people whose faces rested naturally in a smile and I'm certain their lives were much different because of that." -- Jonathan Hull

item.title: Jen add a quote by Jonathan Hull
Jen add a quote by Jonathan Hull
item.description: "Like most bookworms I read so as not to be alone, which often annoys those who are trying to make conversation with me." -- Jonathan Hull

item.title: Jen add a quote by Michael Perry
item.description: "It is the blessing of dumb work done close to the earth-one gritty minute at a time, we move forward." -- Michael Perry

item.title: Jen add a quote by Michael Perry
item.description: "As usual, I overdreamed and underbudgeted. . . " -- Michael Perry

item.title: Jen add a quote by Charles Frazier
item.description: "They call this war a cloud over the land. But they made the weather and then they stand in the rain and say 'Shit, it's raining!" -- Charles Frazier

item.title: Jen add a quote by Charles Frazier
item.description: "I know I don't need him, but I think I want him." -- Charles Frazier

item.title: Jen add a quote by Charles Frazier
item.description: "[No] matter what a waste one has made of one's life, it is ever possible to find some path to redemption, however partial." -- Charles Frazier

item.title: Jen add a quote by Charles Frazier
item.description: "The man had asked, Why do you want sheep? The wool? Meat? Monroe's answer had been, For the atmosphere." -- Charles Frazier

item.title: Jen add a quote by Walt Whitman
item.description: "Do anything, but let it produce joy." -- Walt Whitman

item.title: Jen add a quote by Walt Whitman
item.description: "I am satisfied ... I see, dance, laugh, sing. " -- Walt Whitman

item.title: Jen add a quote by Walt Whitman
item.description: "Long enough have you dream'd contemptible dreams, Now I wash the gum from your eyes, You must habit yourself to the dazzle of the light and of every moment of your life" -- Walt Whitman

item.title: Jen add a quote by Rumi
item.description: "If you are irritated by every rub, how will your mirror be polished?" -- Rumi

item.title: Jen add a quote by Rumi
item.description: "You were born with wings, why prefer to crawl through life?" -- Rumi

item.title: Jen add a quote by Rumi
item.description: "The wound is the place where the Light enters you." -- Rumi

item.title: Jen add a quote by Kahill Gibran
item.description: "You pray in your distress and in your need; would that you might pray also in the fullness of your joy and in your days of abundance." -- Kahill Gibran

item.title: Jen add a quote by Kahill Gibran
item.description: "To belittle, you have to be little." -- Kahill Gibran

item.title: Jen add a quote by Kahill Gibran
item.description: "Your daily life is your temple and your religion." -- Kahill Gibran

item.title: Jen add a quote by Khalil Gibran
item.description: "One day you will ask me which is more important? My life or yours? I will say mine and you will walk away not knowing that you are my life." -- Khalil Gibran

item.title: Jen add a quote by Kahlil Gibran
item.description: "I have learned silence from the talkative, toleration from the intolerant, and kindness from the unkind; yet strange, I am ungrateful to these teachers." -- Kahlil Gibran

item.title: Jen add a quote by Kahlil Gibran
item.description: "For what is it to die but to stand naked in the wind and to melt into the sun? And when the earth shall claim your limbs, then shall you truly dance." -- Kahlil Gibran

item.title: Jen add a quote by Harriet Van Horne
item.description: "Cooking is like love; it should be entered into with abandon or not at all." -- Harriet Van Horne

item.title: Jen add a quote by Julia Child
item.description: "Everything in moderation... including moderation." -- Julia Child
